title: Strinesdale Reservoir and Country Park Walking Route

images.title: Strinesdale by David Dixon, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Strinesdale reservoir view. The original reservoirs were built in 1828 and the erected plaque can be seen at Upper Strinesdale. Later in the early 1990s, these reservoirs were drained and replaced by two smaller lakes with the old reservoir sites being planted with trees and grassland.

images.title: Martin Clark / Walkers at Lower Strine Dale Reservoir
images.caption: Walkers crossing the footbridge at Lower Strine Dale Reservoir. Located near Barrowshaw, Waterhead, east of Oldham.

images.title: Strinesdale Upper Reservoir by David Dixon, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Upper Reservoir

images.title: Roebuck Inn and Restaurant, Strinesdale by David Dixon, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Roebuck Inn and Restaurant, Strinesdale

images.title: michael ely / Strine Dale, Waterhead
images.caption: Looking north over the small reservoir close to the Visitor Centre car park. Houses at Moorside can be seen on the skyline left of shot.

images.title: Medlock Valley Way by David Dixon, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Medlock Valley Way path on the western side of the site.

description: This circular walk explores the Strinesdale Country Park and reservoirs in Oldham. In the park you'll find two pretty reservoirs with two colour coded walking trails to follow. There's also woodland trails, meadows and nice views of the surrounding countryside to enjoy. You can start the walk from the car park and visitor centre at the southern end of the site. As you make your way around the lakes look out for various birds including Herons and kestrels. The trail runs for just over a mile so should take around 30-45 minutes to complete. The Medlock Valley Way runs right through the park. You could extend your walk by picking up this waymarked trail and following it south to the River Medlock and the pretty Daisy Nook Country Park .

details.subtitle: Pubs/Cafes
details.content: Just to the east of the park there's The Roebuck Inn for some post walk refreshments. You can find them at postcode OL4 3RB for your sat navs.

details.subtitle: Dog Walking
details.content: The lakeside and woodland trails are ideal for dog walking so you'll probably see other owners with their pets on your visit.

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: Head a few miles south east and you could continue your waterside walking at the popular Dovestone Reservoir and Greenfield Reservoir. The climb to the splendid viewpoint at Dovestone Rocks is also located in this area. Just to the north you can pick up the Crompton Circuit and enjoy a circular walk around Shaw and Crompton Moor. For more walking ideas in the area see the Greater Manchester Walks page.

display_address: Holgate Street, Top O' Th' Meadows, Waterhead, Lees, Oldham, Greater Manchester, England, OL4 3NY, United Kingdom
